title: Merge Community Call #3
body:

Friday, Feb 11 at 14:00 UTC (9:00 ET)
Duration: 60 mins

## Pre-call Resources
- [How The Merge Impacts Ethereum’s Application Layer](https://blog.ethereum.org/2021/11/29/how-the-merge-impacts-app-layer/)
- [AllCoreDevs Update 007 ⛓](https://hackmd.io/@timbeiko/acd/https%3A%2F%2Ftim.mirror.xyz%2FsR23jU02we6zXRgsF_oTUkttL83S3vyn05vJWnnp-Lc) - details about post merge Execution and Consensus client architectures
- [Ethereum Protocol Update - Nov 2021](https://trent.mirror.xyz/82eyq_NXZzzqFmCNXiKJgSdayf6omCW7BgDQIneyPoA) - high level overview of changes coming with the merge, naming conventions

## Discussion
- post-Merge [Testnets](https://twitter.com/peter_szilagyi/status/1484548996169408512)
- Kintsugi and its replacement
- getting applications to deploy and test on the new devnet
- block times go from ~13s to exactly 12s from PoW to PoS. eg. will impact lending contracts that make assumptions for calculating annual rates
- tx fees go to validator address on the Execution layer: [see here](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/specification.md#payloadattributesv1)
- Validators should run both and Execution and Consensus client. Outsourcing to infura / web3 providers will be discouraged to prepare for Proof of Custody designs
- [EIP-4399](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-4399.md)
- Help Marius with testing: [Merge Testing](https://hackmd.io/WKpg6SNzQbi1jVKNgrSgWg?view)

↓ Leave a comment to add a topic ↓

If you want to subscribe to announcements about The Merge/network upgrades, a google group is now available: https://groups.google.com/a/ethereum.org/g/announcements 

If you are not a Google email user, you can subscribe by emailing announcements+subscribe@ethereum.org
